title: Louis Tomlinson Teases Australian Tour Dates: â€˜Itâ€™s Happeningâ€™
summary: The singer teased the plans during an interview on The Smallzy Show on Friday.
body: Louis Tomlinson has all but confirmed a return to Australia, telling fans that tour dates Down Under are not only coming, but theyâ€™re also inevitable. The singer teased the plans during an interview on The Smallzy Show on Friday (Jan. 23), after host Smallzy pointed out that Tomlinson has already announced tour dates across the U.K., Europe and the U.S. running from March through July. â€œI think youâ€™ve done tour dates for some parts of the world, is that right?â€ Smallzy asked. â€œYeah, Australia dates arenâ€™t out there yet, though,â€ Tomlinson replied . When Smallzy referenced a side-eye emoji Tomlinson had previously left in response to a fan asking about Australian dates, the former One Direction member leaned fully into the speculation. â€œI always find the question kind of funny because as long as Iâ€™ve been touring, Iâ€™ve always come to Aus. Itâ€™s inevitable,â€ Tomlinson said. â€œI love it there, I love it. So yeah, Iâ€™ll definitely, definitely be there. I think weâ€™re just â€” it canâ€™t be too long until we announce, to be honest.â€ As Smallzy jokingly cautioned against giving fans false hope, Tomlinson doubled down. â€œNo, itâ€™s happening. Donâ€™t mind them. Itâ€™s happening. The tourâ€™s happening. Gâ€¦

title: Olivia Dean Tops triple jâ€™s Hottest 100 of 2025 With â€˜Man IÂ Needâ€™
summary: The British singer-songwriter finished ahead of Keli Holidayâ€™s â€œDancing2â€ at No. 2 and Tame Impalaâ€™s â€œDraculaâ€ at No.
body: Olivia Dean has claimed the No. 1 spot in triple jâ€™s Hottest 100 of 2025 , with â€œMan I Needâ€ topping the annual listener-voted countdown as results were revealed to Australian listeners on Saturday. The British singer-songwriter finished ahead of Keli Holidayâ€™s â€œDancing2â€ at No. 2 and Tame Impalaâ€™s â€œDraculaâ€ at No. 3, capping a tightly contested countdown that featured a strong mix of Australian and international artists. Dean also placed two additional tracks in the top 20, with â€œSo Easy (To Fall In Love)â€ landing at No. 11 and her collaboration with Sam Fender, â€œRein Me In,â€ finishing at No. 14. This yearâ€™s countdown was marked by a number of notable milestones. According to triple j, 26 artists made their Hottest 100 debut in 2025, while several acts logged multiple entries across the list. Australian artists were particularly prominent throughout the countdown, continuing a trend that has defined recent editions of the Hottest 100. Hilltop Hoods added to their long-running presence in the poll with two entries in the top 100, while Spacey Jane placed six tracks overall, including â€œWhateverrrrâ€ at No. 6 and â€œThrough My Teethâ€ at No. 31. Ocean Alley also appeared multiple times,â€¦

title: Dolly Parton Jokes About Outliving Plastic Surgeons as She Turns 80: â€˜Happy Birthday toÂ Me!â€™
summary: The iconic singer also treated fans to a new song on her Jan. 19 birthday.
body: Dolly Parton celebrated her milestone birthday with laughs and new music. To celebrate her 80th birthday on Monday (Jan. 19), the iconic singer-songwriter shared a new version of her 1977 song â€œLight of a Clear Blue Morningâ€ and some laughs in a video on Instagram . Related Dolly Parton Teams With Miley Cyrus, Reba McEntire, Queen Latifah & Lainey Wilson for 80th-Birthday Version of ‘Light of a Clear Blue Morning’ Watch Keith Urban’s Sweet Birthday Message for Dolly Parton Dolly Parton Says She Wonâ€™t Attend Grand Ole Opry 80th Birthday Celebration in Video Message: ‘Sending You All My Love’ “Well, hey there! Itâ€™s Dolly, and Iâ€™ve made it! Iâ€™m 80 years old,” Parton said. “Can you believe that? Anyway, what do you give somebody thatâ€™s 80 years old? Well, you donâ€™t take gifts. You give things.” She added, “Iâ€™m gonna give you the gift of a bunch of friends that stopped by to help me sing on a song called â€˜Light of a Clear Blue Morning,â€™ a song I wrote years ago. In fact, itâ€™s 50 years old. We did a new version of it, Kent Wells producing it, and then Iâ€™m giving you the gift of Queen Latifah, Reba McEntire, Mâ€¦

title: Harry Styles Together, Together 2026 Tour Features a 30-Night Residency at MSG: Shop TicketsÂ Here
summary: Styles is back and ready to boogie with fans once more with this new tour in support of his upcoming solo album Kiss All the Time. Disco, Occasionally.
body: All products and services featured are independently chosen by editors. However, Billboard may receive a commission on orders placed through its retail links, and the retailer may receive certain auditable data for accounting purposes. Harry Styles is going back on tour in 2026 with all new music. The newly announced tour, called Together, Together, features 50 dates in a total of seven cities with Styles visiting Europe, North America, Latin America and Australia. The tour is in support of the British artist’s upcoming fourth solo LP, Kiss All the Time. Disco, Occasionally , due for release on Mar. 6 via Columbia. The first show kicks off in Amsterdam, Netherlands, on May 16 and is slated to conclude in Sydney, Australia, on Dec. 13. The first stop in America is in New York on Aug. 26 at Madison Square Garden and will end in the same place, Madison Square Garden, on Oct. 31. That’s a 30-night stint at the iconic New York venue, giving American audiences plenty of time to see the star before he heads to Melbourne. A slew of big names will be making appearances on Styles’ tour, including Robyn, Shania Twain , Fcukers, Jamie xx, Jorja Smith, Fousheé, Skye Neâ€¦

title: Charli XCX Discusses Acting Career and Moving Beyond â€˜Bratâ€™ Era at 2026 Sundance FilmÂ Festival
summary: "I am like the me in the [The Moment] where I am wanting Brat to stop and pivot," she said.
body: Charli XCX is opening up about her career beyond music at the 2026 Sundance Film Festival in Park City, Utah. During a Q&A panel following the premiere of her new A24 film The Moment on Friday (Jan. 23), the 33-year-old pop star discussed her evolving acting career and whether her real-life persona differs from the heightened version of herself depicted in the upcoming mockumentary, which is inspired by her blockbuster Brat album and world tour. Related Charli xcx’s ‘brat’ Goes b2b on Dance Year-End Charts: Countdown to Billboard’s 2025 Year-End Charts Flip Through Charli XCX’s Fashion Journey With This ‘Brat’ Green Book on Amazon Charli XCX Bids Farewell to ‘Brat’ Era at South Korean Show, Teases ‘The Moment’ Film â€œI’m obviously quite related to my character, so I had a lot of inspiration to pull from,â€ Charli said . â€œI would like to think I’m not as much of a nightmare as Charli in the film, but my real managers are in the audience and they probably know the true answer to that.” The Moment , directed by Aidan Zamiri, follows “a rising pop star navigates the complexities â€¦

title: Tired Liverpool players 'falling over their own feet' - Slot
summary: Liverpool manager Arne Slot believes his players were incredibly tired in their defeat against Bournemouth, to the extent Jeremy Frimpong was "falling over his own feet" after coming off.

title: Adli's stoppage-time winner ends Liverpool unbeaten run in thriller
summary: Amine Adli scores a stoppage-time winner as Bournemouth end Liverpool's 13-game unbeaten run in a thrilling match at Vitality Stadium.

title: Bowen leads West Ham to important win over Sunderland
summary: A fantastic first-half performance helps West Ham blow away Sunderland and move to within two points of 17th-placed Nottingham Forest and safety.

title: Late Romero header rescues draw for Tottenham at Burnley
summary: Cristian Romero rescues a point for Tottenham Hotspur late on just as under-pressure head coach Thomas Frank faced further embarrassment against struggling Burnley at Turf Moor.

title: Marmoush scores as Man City return to winning ways against Wolves
summary: Omar Marmoush scores his first Premier League goal of the season to help Manchester City return to winning ways by easing past bottom side Wolves at Etihad Stadium.

title: Late Wilson free-kick completes Fulham comeback win over Brighton
summary: Harry Wilson scores a spectacular late free-kick as Fulham come from behind to defeat Brighton at Craven Cottage.

title: Rod Stewart Rips Into â€˜Draft Dodgerâ€™ Donald Trump for Insulting NATO Troops inÂ Afghanistan
summary: â€œI may just be a humble rock star, but Iâ€™m also a Knight of the realm, and I have my opinions," he said.
body: Sir Rod Stewart is firing back at Donald Trump. On Friday (Jan. 23), the 81-year-old rock legend criticized the president in a video shared on social media after Trump suggested that NATO troops avoided the front lines during the war in Afghanistan. Related Rod Stewart Extends One Last Time Tour With 15 Additional 2026 U.S. Dates Dolly Parton Jokes About Outliving Plastic Surgeons as She Turns 80: 'Happy Birthday to Me!' Rod Stewart to Receive Lifetime Achievement Award & Perform at 2025 American Music Awards â€œI may just be a humble rock star, Iâ€™m also a Knight of the realm and I have my opinions,â€ Stewart said in the Instagram clip. â€œI was born just after the war (World War II) and I have great respect for our armed forces that fought and gave us our freedom. So it hurts me badly, deeply, when I read that the draft dodger Trump has criticized our troops in Afghanistan for not being on the front line.â€ Stewart went on to highlight the sacrifices made by U.K. service members, noting that more than 400 British personnel served during the prolonged conflict in Afghanistan. “Think of their parents. Think about it,” the singer-songwriter continued. &â€¦

title: â€˜Saturday Night Liveâ€™: How to Watch the Variety Comedy Show Online Without Cable forÂ Free
summary: Teyana Taylor hosts, while Geese performs as musical guest on Saturday, Jan. 24.
body: All products and services featured are independently chosen by editors. However, Billboard may receive a commission on orders placed through its retail links, and the retailer may receive certain auditable data for accounting purposes. Golden Globe-winner Teyana Taylor is hosting Saturday Night Live this week. The One Battle After Another -star is set as host for the first time on Saturday, Jan. 24. Additionally, the variety comedy show has musical guest Geese on the books. SNL broadcasts live on NBC with a start time of 11:30 p.m. ET/PT. Taylor, who is nominated for best supporting actress for the 98th Academy Awards, is having a great year so far after the success of One Battle After Another , while she co-stars in the action movie The Rip on Netflix. Although she’s not performing as musical guest on SNL this week, Teyana Taylor also released a hit album Escape Room during the summer of 2025. Meanwhile, indie art rock darlings Geese is set to perform as musical guest. The band is coming off the release of their critically-acclaimed album Getting Killed , while 2026 is positioned to be a big year for the Brooklyn-based band. Want to watch SNL online without cable and for frâ€¦

title: Becky G Celebrates Selena and Isabel Allende in â€˜Celebrity Substituteâ€™ & More Uplifting Moments in LatinÂ Music
summary: Plus, Mon Laferte, Lunay, Santos Bravos, Feid & More Latin Stars Shine at Willy ChavarrÃ­a's Paris Fashion Week Show.
body: From career milestones to new music releases to major announcements and those little important moments,  Billboard  editors highlight uplifting moments in Latin music. Hereâ€™s what happened in the Latin music world this week. Becky G Inspires Schoolchildren in Celebrity Substitute In a new episode of Celebrity Substitute , Becky G visited Dos Puentes Elementary School in Washington Heights, New York, for Career Day. She delivered a lesson on identity and highlighted Latina heroes like writer and activist Isabel Allende, space engineer Diana Trujillo, and the late superstar Selena, while exploring what it truly means to shine. “A lot of times society tells us who we are supposed to be,” Becky G tells the host Julian Shapiro-Barnum during the episode. “When we’re young, we have this genuine belief that we can be whatever we want to be.” The 16-minute video wraps up with a special music video featuring the singer and her class, highlighting the Career Day theme. Previous celebrity substitutes have included Rauw Alejandro and Camila Cabello. Becky G is currently promoting her new documentary, Rebecca . Mon Laferte, Lunay & More Latin Stars Shâ€¦

title: NASA Sets Briefings for SpaceX Crew-12 Mission to Space Station
summary: NASA and its partners will discuss the upcoming crew rotation to the International Space Station during a pair of news conferences on Friday, Jan. 30, from the agencyâ€™s Johnson Space Center in Houston. At 11 a.m. EST, mission leadership will discuss final launch and mission preparations in a news câ€¦
body: NASAâ€™s SpaceX Crew-12 crew, from left to right, is NASA astronauts Jessica Meir and Jack Hathaway, ESA (European Space Agency) astronaut Sophie Adenot, and Roscosmos cosmonaut Andrey Fedyaev. Credit: SpaceX NASA and its partners will discuss the upcoming crew rotation to the International Space Station during a pair of news conferences on Friday, Jan. 30, from the agencyâ€™s Johnson Space Center in Houston. At 11 a.m. EST, mission leadership will discuss final launch and mission preparations in a news conference that will stream on the agencyâ€™s YouTube channel. Next, the crew of NASAâ€™s SpaceX Crew-12 mission will participate in a virtual news conference from NASA Johnson crew quarters at 1 p.m., also on the agencyâ€™s YouTube channel. Individual streams for each of the events will be available on that page. This is the final media opportunity with Crew-12 before they travel to NASAâ€™s Kennedy Space Center in Florida for launch. Crew-12 will carry NASA astronauts Jessica Meir and Jack Hathaway , ESA (European Space Agency) astronaut Sophie Adenot, and Roscosmos cosmonaut Andrey Fedyaev to the orbiting laboratory. The crew will launch aboard a SpaceX Dragon spacecraft on the companyâ€™s Faâ€¦

title: NASA Awards Global Modeling, Assimilation Support Contract
summary: NASA has selected ADNET Systems, Inc. of Bethesda, Maryland, to provide global modeling and data assimilation support at the agencyâ€™s Goddard Space Flight Center in Greenbelt, Maryland. The Global Modeling and Assimilation Support contract is a single-award, cost-plus-fixed-fee, indefinite-deliveryâ€¦
body: Credit: NASA NASA has selected ADNET Systems, Inc. of Bethesda, Maryland, to provide global modeling and data assimilation support at the agencyâ€™s Goddard Space Flight Center in Greenbelt, Maryland. The Global Modeling and Assimilation Support contract is a single-award, cost-plus-fixed-fee, indefinite-delivery/indefinite-quantity contract with a maximum ordering value of approximately $84 million with a five-year period of performance beginning March 15, 2026. Under this contract, the contractor will be responsible for supporting and maintaining NASA Goddardâ€™s Global Modeling and Assimilation Officeâ€™s Goddard Earth Observing System (GEOS) model and data assimilation system. Tasks include supporting the development and validation of individual model components within GEOS and the development and integration of external components like sea and land-ice models within the modeling and assimilation system. For information about NASA and other agency programs, visit: https://www.nasa.gov -end- Tiernan Doyle Headquarters, Washington 202-358-1600 tiernan.doyle@nasa.gov Rob Garner Goddard Space Flight Center, Greenbelt, Md. 301-286-5687 rob.garner@nasa.gov Share Details Last Updated Jan 2â€¦

title: NASA Selects Participants to Track Artemis II Mission
summary: NASA has selected 34 global volunteers to track the Orion spacecraft during the crewed Artemis II missionâ€™s journey around the Moon. The Artemis II test flight will launch NASAâ€™s Space Launch System (SLS) rocket, carrying the Orion spacecraft and a crew of four astronauts, on a mission into deep spâ€¦
body: 4 Min Read NASA Selects Participants to Track Artemis II Mission A visual representation of NASA’s Artemis I mission. Credits: NASA NASA has selected 34 global volunteers to track the Orion spacecraft during the crewed Artemis II missionâ€™s journey around the Moon. The Artemis II test flight will launch NASAâ€™s Space Launch System (SLS) rocket, carrying the Orion spacecraft and a crew of four astronauts, on a mission into deep space. The agencyâ€™s second mission in the Artemis campaign is a key step in NASAâ€™s path toward establishing a long-term presence at the Moon and confirming the systems needed to support future lunar surface exploration and paving the way for the first crewed mission to Mars. While NASAâ€™s Near Space Network and Deep Space Network , coordinated by the agencyâ€™s SCaN (Space Communication and Navigation) program , will provide primary communications and tracking services to support Orionâ€™s launch, journey around the Moon, and return to Earth, participants selected from a request for proposals published in August 2025, comprised of established commercial service providers, members of academia, and individual amateur radio enthusiasts will use their respective â€¦

title: I Am Artemis: Dustin Gohmert
summary: Listen to this audio excerpt from Dustin Gohmert, Orion Crew Survival System (OCSS) manager: During NASAâ€™s Artemis II mission around the Moon, the astronauts inside the Orion spacecraft will be wearing specialized pressure suits designed to protect them throughout their journey. At NASAâ€™s Johnson Sâ€¦
body: 3 Min Read I Am Artemis: Dustin Gohmert Dustin Gohmert, Orion Crew Survival System (OCSS) manager, sits in the OCSS Lab at NASA’s Johnson Space Center in Houston. Credits: NASA/Rad Sinyak Listen to this audio excerpt from Dustin Gohmert, Orion Crew Survival System (OCSS) manager: 0:00 / 0:00 Your browser does not support the audio element. During NASAâ€™s Artemis II mission around the Moon, the astronauts inside the Orion spacecraft will be wearing specialized pressure suits designed to protect them throughout their journey. At NASAâ€™s Johnson Space Center in Houston, Dustin Gohmert leads the team responsible for these suits, known as the Orion Crew Survival System (OCSS). â€œWe work with the crew to say, â€˜Hereâ€™s this design concept we have. How does this really work in the spaceflight environment?â€™â€ Gohmert said. â€œAs we evolve the design, we take the crewâ€™s input and we adapt the suit over time to take into account not only the desire we have for safety, but the real-world impacts that it has.â€ The suits will protect astronauts on launch day, throughout high-risk parts of missions near the Moon, during the high-speed return to Earth, and in emergency situations if such events arâ€¦

title: Red, Green Light Show
summary: A green and red aurora streams across Earthâ€™s horizon above the city lights of Europe in this Jan. 19, 2026, photograph, which looks north across Italy toward Germany. The International Space Station was orbiting 262 miles above the Mediterranean Sea at approximately 10:02 p.m. local time when the â€¦
body: NASA/Chris Williams A green and red aurora streams across Earthâ€™s horizon above the city lights of Europe in this Jan. 19, 2026, photograph, which looks north across Italy toward Germany. The International Space Station was orbiting 262 miles above the Mediterranean Sea at approximately 10:02 p.m. local time when the image was captured. Also known as the northern lights ( aurora borealis ) or southern lights ( aurora australis ), auroras are colorful, dynamic, and often visually delicate displays of an intricate dance of particles and magnetism between the Sun and Earth called space weather. When energetic particles from space collide with atoms and molecules in the atmosphere, they can cause the colorful glow that we call auroras. Image credit: NASA/Chris Williams

title: NASA Finds Lunar Regolith Limits Meteorites as Source of Earthâ€™s Water
summary: A new NASA study of its Apollo lunar soils clarifies the Moonâ€™s record of meteorite impacts and timing of water delivery. These findings place upper bounds on how much water meteorites could have supplied later in Earthâ€™s history. Research has previously shown that meteorites may have been a signifâ€¦
body: 4 min read NASA Finds Lunar Regolith Limits Meteorites as Source of Earthâ€™s Water A close-up view of a portion of a â€œrelatively freshâ€ crater, looking southeast, as photographed during the third Apollo 15 lunar surface moonwalk. Credit: NASA A new NASA study of its Apollo lunar soils clarifies the Moonâ€™s record of meteorite impacts and timing of water delivery. These findings place upper bounds on how much water meteorites could have supplied later in Earthâ€™s history. Research has previously shown that meteorites may have been a significant source of Earthâ€™s water as they bombarded our planet early in the solar systemâ€™s development. In a paper published Tuesday in the Proceedings to the National Academy of Sciences, researchers led by Tony Gargano, a postdoctoral fellow at NASAâ€™s Johnson Space Center and the Lunar and Planetary Institute (LPI), both in Houston, used a novel method for analyzing the dusty debris that covers the Moonâ€™s surface called regolith . They learned that even under generous assumptions, meteorite delivery since about four billion years ago could only have supplied a small fraction of Earthâ€™s water. The Moon serves as an ancient archive of the impact history â€¦

To access these X-ray tracks, or observations, the ultimate compendium has been developed: the Chandra Source Catalog (CSC). The CSC containâ€¦
body: 5 Min Read NASA’s Chandra Releases Deep Cut From Catalog of Cosmic Recordings Like a recording artist who has had a long career,  NASAâ€™s Chandra X-ray Observatory  has a â€œback catalogâ€ of cosmic recordings that is impossible to replicate. To access these X-ray tracks, or observations, the ultimate compendium has been developed: the  Chandra Source Catalog  (CSC). The CSC contains the  X-ray  data detected up to the end of 2020 by Chandra, the worldâ€™s premier X-ray telescope and one of NASAâ€™s â€œGreat Observatories.â€ The latest version of the CSC, known as CSC 2.1, contains over 400,000 unique compact and extended sources and over 1.3 million individual detections in X-ray light. before after This image contains lower-, medium-, and higher-energy X-rays in red, green, and blue respectively. NASA/CXC/SAO; Image Processing: NASA/CXC/SAO/N. Wolk This image is the sum of 86 observations added together, representing over three million seconds of Chandra observing time. It spans just about 60 light-years across, which is a veritable pinprick on the entire sky. The underlying image contains lower-, medium-, and higher-energy X-rays in red, green, and blueâ€¦

title: Journey to Center of Milky Way With Upcoming NASA Roman Core Survey
summary: At the heart of our own galaxy, there is a dense thicket of stars with a supermassive black hole at the very center. NASAâ€™s Nancy Grace Roman Space Telescope will provide the deepest-ever view of this zone, revealing stars, planets, and unique objects that resist definition. Based on the input of aâ€¦
body: At the heart of our own galaxy, there is a dense thicket of stars with a supermassive black hole at the very center. NASAâ€™s Nancy Grace Roman Space Telescope will provide the deepest-ever view of this zone, revealing stars, planets, and unique objects that resist definition. Based on the input of astronomers from across the globe, the Roman Space Telescope will spend three-quarters of its five-year primary mission conducting three revolutionary surveys of unprecedented scale. Their combined results will transform all areas of astronomy and answer longstanding questions about dark matter, dark energy, and planets outside of our solar system, called exoplanets. That last theme will be addressed by the Galactic Bulge Time-Domain Survey, which will peer into the center of our galaxy to study the stars and exoplanets that make up the densely populated region around the center of the Milky Way, known as the galactic bulge. This infographic describes the Galactic Bulge Time-Domain Survey that will be conducted by NASAâ€™s Nancy Grace Roman Space Telescope. The smallest of Romanâ€™s core surveys, this observation program will consist of repeat visits to six fields covering 1.7 square degrees â€¦

title: Booze, beach, beaten - how England lost the Ashes
summary: BBC Sport chief cricket reporter Stephan Shemilt reveals the inside story of England's Ashes defeat in Australia on and off the pitch.

title: I've realised I can make a difference - Hoy
summary: In a new BBC documentary, Sir Chris Hoy shows how he is using his Olympic mindset to reframe his purpose following a terminal cancer diagnosis.

title: The man behind the headlines - Salah, by Klopp, Diaz and more
summary: BBC Sport explores Mohamed Salah's personality with help from the people who know him best.

title: Inside McLaren's season - the rules, values, incidents & relationships
summary: Intra-team title battles turn toxic far more often than not. Andrew Benson analyses how McLaren have maintained relative harmony between Lando Norris and Oscar Piastri.

title: England's AI World Cup masterplan - from perfecting penalties to powering players
summary: BBC Sport hears from inside the England setup about how artificial intelligence is powering plans for next summer's World Cup.
